Package com.poloniex.api.client.rest

Class PoloRestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poloniex.api.client.rest.PoloRestClient
  • public class PoloRestClient
extends Object
    Client which connects to Poloniex public and private Rest endpoints

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoloRestClient

        public PoloRestClient​(String host)
        creates public api service
        Parameters:
        host - host base url
        Example:
          PoloRestClient poloniexApiClient = new PoloRestClient("https://sandbox-api.poloniex.com");

      • PoloRestClient

        public PoloRestClient​(String host,
                      String apiKey,
                      String secret)
        creates public and private api services
        Parameters:
        host - host base url
        apiKey - Polo API Key for user
        secret - Polo secret for API Key
        Example:
          PoloRestClient poloniexApiClient = new PoloRestClient("https://sandbox-api.poloniex.com", "<YOUR_API_KEY>", "<YOUR_SECRET>");

      • getCurrencies

        public List<Map<String,​Currency>> getCurrencies()
        Currency Information: get all supported currencies
        Returns:
        list of currencies
        Example:
          List<Map<String, Currency>> currencies = poloniexApiClient.getCurrencies();

      • getCurrencies

        public List<Map<String,​Currency>> getCurrencies​(Boolean includeMultiChainCurrencies)
        Currency Information: get all supported currencies
        Parameters:
        includeMultiChainCurrencies - Default is false. Indicates if multi chain currencies are included. If set to true, additionally adds a new row for each currency on their respective chain (i.e USDT, USDTETH, USDTTRON will all have entries).
        Returns:
        list of currencies
        Example:
          List<Map<String, Currency>> currencies = poloniexApiClient.getCurrencies(true);

      • getCurrency

        public Map<String,​Currency> getCurrency​(String currency,
                                              Boolean includeMultiChainCurrencies)
        Currency Information: get currency
        Parameters:
        currency - currency name
        includeMultiChainCurrencies - Default is false. Indicates if multi chain currencies are included. If set to true, additionally adds a new row for each currency on their respective chain (i.e USDT, USDTETH, USDTTRON will all have entries).
        Returns:
        list of currencies
        Example:
          List<Map<String, Currency>> currencies = poloniexApiClient.getCurrencies("BTC", null);

      • getOrderBook

        public OrderBook getOrderBook​(String symbol,
                              String scale,
                              Integer limit)
        Order Book: Get the order book for a given symbol
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol name
        scale - controls aggregation by price
        limit - maximum number of records returned. The default value of limit is 10. Valid limit values are: 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 150.
        Returns:
        order book
        Example:
          OrderBook orderBook = poloniexApiClient.getOrderBook("BTC_USDT", "10", 10);

      • getCandles

        public List<List<String>> getCandles​(String symbol,
                                     String interval,
                                     Integer limit,
                                     Long startTime,
                                     Long endTime)
        Candles: Returns OHLC for a symbol at given timeframe (interval).
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol name
        interval - the unit of time to aggregate data by. Valid values: MINUTE_1, MINUTE_5, MINUTE_10, MINUTE_15, MINUTE_30, HOUR_1, HOUR_2, HOUR_4, HOUR_6, HOUR_12, DAY_1, DAY_3, WEEK_1 and MONTH_1
        limit - maximum number of records returned. The default value is 100 and the max value is 500.
        startTime - filters by time. The default value is 0.
        endTime - filters by time. The default value is current time
        Returns:
        a list of candles
        Example:
          List<List<String>> candles = poloniexApiClient.getCandles("ETH_USDT", "MINUTE_5", 5, 0L, System.currentTimeMillis());

      • getMarketTrades

        public List<MarketTrade> getMarketTrades​(String symbol,
                                         Integer limit)
        Trades: Returns a list of recent trades, request param limit is optional, its default value is 500, and max value is 1000.
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol name
        limit - maximum number of records returned
        Returns:
        list of trades
        Example:
          List<MarketTrade> marketTrades = poloniexApiClient.getMarketTrades("BTC_USDT", 2);

      • getAccountBalancesByType

        public List<AccountBalance> getAccountBalancesByType​(String accountType)
        Account Balances by type:
        Parameters:
        accountType - The account type. e.g. SPOT. Passing null will show all account types.
        Returns:
        a list of all accounts of a user with each account’s id, type and balances (assets).
        Example:
          List<AccountBalance> accountBalances = poloniexApiClient.getAccountBalancesByType("SPOT");

      • getAccountBalancesById

        public List<AccountBalance> getAccountBalancesById​(Long accountId)
        Account Balances endpoint:
        Parameters:
        accountId - The account ID
        Returns:
        get a list of all accounts of a user with each account’s id, type and balances (assets).
        Example:
          List<AccountBalance> accountBalances = poloniexApiClient.getAccountBalancesById(Long.parseLong(accounts.get(0).getAccountId()));

      • accountsTransfer

        public AccountsTransferResponse accountsTransfer​(AccountsTransferRequest accountsTransferRequest)
        Accounts Transfer: Transfer amount of currency from an account to another account for a user.
        Parameters:
        accountsTransferRequest - details for transfer
        Returns:
        response with transferId
        Example:
          AccountsTransferResponse accountsTransferResponse = poloniexApiClient.accountsTransfer(AccountsTransferRequest.builder().currency("USDT").amount("10.5").fromAccount("SPOT").toAccount("FUTURES").build());

      • getAccountsTransfers

        public List<AccountsTransferRecord> getAccountsTransfers​(Integer limit,
                                                         Long from,
                                                         String direction,
                                                         String currency)
        Accounts Transfer Records: Get a list of transfer records of a user.
        Parameters:
        limit - The max number of records could be returned.
        from - it is 'transferId'. The query begin at ‘from', and the default is 0.
        direction - PRE, NEXT, default is NEXT
        currency - The transferred currency, like USDT. Default is for all currencies, if not specified.
        Returns:
        a list of transfer records of a user.
        Example:
          List<AccountsTransferRecord> accountsTransferRecords = poloniexApiClient.getAccountsTransfers(null, null, null, null);

      • getAccountsTransfers

        public List<AccountsTransferRecord> getAccountsTransfers​(Integer limit,
                                                         Long from,
                                                         String direction,
                                                         String currency,
                                                         Long startTime,
                                                         Long endTime)
        Accounts Transfer Records: Get a list of transfer records of a user.
        Parameters:
        limit - The max number of records could be returned.
        from - it is 'transferId'. The query begin at ‘from', and the default is 0.
        direction - PRE, NEXT, default is NEXT
        currency - The transferred currency, like USDT. Default is for all currencies, if not specified.
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) transfers before start time will not be retrieved.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) transfers after end time will not be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a list of transfer records of a user.
        Example:
          List<AccountsTransferRecord> accountsTransferRecords = poloniexApiClient.getAccountsTransfers(null, null, null, null);

      • getAccountsTransferById

        public AccountsTransferRecord getAccountsTransferById​(Long id)
        Accounts Transfer Records by ID
        Parameters:
        id - transfer ID
        Returns:
        transfer record
        Example:
          AccountsTransferRecord accountsTransferRecord = poloniexApiClient.getAccountsTransferById(123L);

      • getAccountsActivity

        public List<ActivityResponse> getAccountsActivity​(Long startTime,
                                                  Long endTime,
                                                  Integer activityType,
                                                  Integer limit,
                                                  Long from,
                                                  String direction,
                                                  String currency)
        Account Activity: Get a list of activities such as airdrop, rebates, staking, credit/debit adjustments, and other (historical adjustments).
        Parameters:
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) Trades filled before startTime will not be retrieved.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) Trades filled after endTime will not be retrieved.
        activityType - Type of activity: ALL: 200, AIRDROP: 201, COMMISSION_REBATE: 202, STAKING: 203, REFERAL_REBATE: 204, CREDIT_ADJUSTMENT: 104, DEBIT_ADJUSTMENT: 105, OTHER: 199
        limit - The max number of records could be returned. Default is 100 and max is 1000.
        from - It is 'id'. The query begin at ‘from', and the default is 0.
        direction - PRE, NEXT, default is NEXT
        currency - The transferred currency, like USDT. Default is for all currencies, if not specified.
        Returns:
        List of account activity
        Example:
          List<ActivityResponse> activityResponseList = poloniexApiClient.getAccountsActivity(1662005301209L, System.currentTimeMillis(), 200, 100, 0L, "NEXT", "");

      • getFeeInfo

        public FeeInfo getFeeInfo()
        Fee Info: Get fee rate for an account
        Returns:
        fee info
        Example:
          FeeInfo feeInfo = poloniexApiClient.getFeeInfo();

      • getSubaccounts

        public List<Subaccount> getSubaccounts()
        Subaccount Info: Get subaccounts for a primary account
        Returns:
        a list of all the accounts within an Account Group for a user.

      • getSubaccountBalances

        public List<Subaccount> getSubaccountBalances()
        Subaccount Balances: Get balances information by currency and account type (SPOT and FUTURES) for each account in the account group. This is only functional for a primary user. A subaccount user can call /accounts/balances for SPOT account type and the futures API overview for its FUTURES balances.
        Returns:
        subaccount balances

      • getSubaccountBalancesById

        public List<Subaccount> getSubaccountBalancesById​(String id)
        Subaccount Balances by ID: Get balances information by currency and account type (SPOT and FUTURES) for a given external accountId in the account group.
        Parameters:
        id - external account ID
        Returns:
        subaccount balances

      • transferForSubaccount

        public SubaccountTransfer transferForSubaccount​(SubaccountTransferRequest request)
        Subaccount Transfer: Transfer amount of currency from an account and account type to another account and account type among the accounts in the account group. Primary account can transfer to and from any subaccounts as well as transfer between 2 subaccounts across account types. Subaccount can only transfer to the primary account across account types.
        Returns:
        transfer respose

      • getSubaccountTransferRecords

        public List<SubaccountTransfer> getSubaccountTransferRecords​(Integer limit,
                                                             Long from,
                                                             String direction,
                                                             String currency,
                                                             String fromAccountId,
                                                             String fromAccountType,
                                                             String toAccountId,
                                                             String toAccountType,
                                                             Long startTime,
                                                             Long endTime)
        Subaccount Transfer Records: Get a list of transfer records of a user. Max interval for start and end time is 6 months. If no start/end time params are specified then records for last 7 days will be returned.
        Parameters:
        limit - The max number of records could be returned. Default is 100 and max is 1000 records.
        from - it is 'transferId'. The query begin at ‘from', and the default is 0.
        direction - PRE, NEXT, default is NEXT
        currency - The transferred currency, like USDT. Default is for all currencies, if not specified.
        fromAccountId - external UID of the from account
        fromAccountType - from account type (SPOT or FUTURES)
        toAccountId - external UID of the to account
        toAccountType - to account type (SPOT or FUTURES)
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) transfers before start time will not be retrieved.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) transfers after end time will not be retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of transfer records

      • getSubaccountTransferRecordsById

        public List<SubaccountTransfer> getSubaccountTransferRecordsById​(Long id)
        Subaccount Transfer Records by ID: Get a single transfer record corresponding to the transferId
        Parameters:
        id - transfer ID
        Returns:
        list of transfer records

      • getDepositAddresses

        public Map<String,​String> getDepositAddresses()
        Deposit Addresses: Get deposit addresses for a user
        Returns:
        map of deposit addresses with key being currency and value being address
        Example:
          Map<String, String> depositAddresses = poloniexApiClient.getDepositAddresses();

      • getDepositAddressesByCurrency

        public Map<String,​String> getDepositAddressesByCurrency​(String currency)
        Deposit Addresses: Get deposit addresses for a user by currency
        Parameters:
        currency - the currency to display for the deposit address. If null is passed, the deposit addresses of all currencies will be displayed.
        Returns:
        map of deposit addresses with key being currency and value being address
        Example:
          Map<String, String> depositAddresses = poloniexApiClient.getDepositAddressesByCurrency("USDT");

      • getWalletsActivities

        public WalletsActivities getWalletsActivities​(Long start,
                                              Long end,
                                              String activityType)
        Wallets Activity Records: Get adjustment, deposit, and withdrawal activity history within a range window for a user
        Parameters:
        start - the start UNIX timestamp of activities
        end - the end UNIX timestamp of activities
        activityType - The type of activity: adjustments, deposits and withdrawals. If no activity type is specified, activities of all types will be returned.
        Returns:
        wallet activity records
        Example:
          WalletsActivities walletsActivities = poloniexApiClient.getWalletsActivities(System.currentTimeMillis() - 10000000L, System.currentTimeMillis(), null);

      • placeOrder

        public Order placeOrder​(String symbol,
                        String side,
                        String timeInForce,
                        String type,
                        String accountType,
                        String price,
                        String quantity,
                        String amount,
                        String clientOrderId)
        Create Order: Create an order for an account.
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol name
        side - BUY, SELL
        timeInForce - GTC, IOC, FOK (Default: GTC)
        type - MARKET, LIMIT, LIMIT_MAKER (Default: MARKET)
        accountType - SPOT is the default and only supported one.
        price - Price is required for non-market orders
        quantity - Quantity is required for MARKET type and SELL side.
        amount - Amount is required for MARKET and BUY side.
        clientOrderId - client order id with a maximum 64-character length
        Returns:
        order details
        Example:
          Order order = poloniexApiClient.placeOrder("BTC_USDT", "BUY", "GTC", "LIMIT", "SPOT", "20640", "1", "", "T_D_UP_" + System.currentTimeMillis());

      • placeOrder

        public Order placeOrder​(OrderRequest orderRequest)
        Create Order: Create an order for an account.
        Parameters:
        orderRequest - order request
        Returns:
        order details
        Example:
          Order order = poloniexApiClient.placeOrder("BTC_USDT", "BUY", "GTC", "LIMIT", "SPOT", "20640", "1", "", "T_D_UP_" + System.currentTimeMillis());

      • placeOrders

        public List<Order> placeOrders​(List<OrderRequest> orderRequests)
        Create Multiple Orders: Create multiple orders via a single request. Max limit of 20 orders. Request parameter is an array of json objects with order details.
        Parameters:
        orderRequests - list of requests with details for creating an order
        Returns:
        list of order details

      • cancelReplaceOrderById

        public Order cancelReplaceOrderById​(String id,
                                    String clientOrderId,
                                    String price,
                                    String quantity,
                                    String amount,
                                    String type,
                                    String timeInForce,
                                    Boolean allowBorrow,
                                    String proceedOnFailure)
        Cancel Replace Order: Cancel an existing active order, new or partially filled, and place a new order on the same symbol with details from existing order unless amended by new parameters. The replacement order can amend price, quantity, amount, type, timeInForce, and allowBorrow fields. Specify the existing order id in the path; if id is a clientOrderId, prefix with cid: e.g. cid:myId-1. The proceedOnFailure flag is intended to specify whether to continue with new order placement in case cancelation of the existing order fails.
        Parameters:
        id - order id
        clientOrderId - client order id with a maximum 64-character length
        price - Price is required for non-market orders
        quantity - Quantity is required for MARKET type and SELL side.
        amount - Amount is required for MARKET and BUY side.
        type - MARKET, LIMIT, LIMIT_MAKER (Default: MARKET)
        timeInForce - GTC, IOC, FOK (Default: GTC)
        allowBorrow - allow order to be placed by borrowing funds (Default: false)
        proceedOnFailure - if set to true then new order will be placed even if cancelation of the existing order fails; if set to false (DEFAULT value) then new order will not be placed if the cancelation of the existing order fails
        Returns:
        order details

      • cancelReplaceOrderByClientOrderId

        public Order cancelReplaceOrderByClientOrderId​(String clientOrderId,
                                               String price,
                                               String quantity,
                                               String amount,
                                               String type,
                                               String timeInForce,
                                               Boolean allowBorrow,
                                               String proceedOnFailure)
        Cancel Replace Order: Cancel an existing active order, new or partially filled, and place a new order on the same symbol with details from existing order unless amended by new parameters. The replacement order can amend price, quantity, amount, type, timeInForce, and allowBorrow fields. Specify the existing order id in the path; if id is a clientOrderId, prefix with cid: e.g. cid:myId-1. The proceedOnFailure flag is intended to specify whether to continue with new order placement in case cancelation of the existing order fails.
        Parameters:
        clientOrderId - client order id with a maximum 64-character length
        price - Price is required for non-market orders
        quantity - Quantity is required for MARKET type and SELL side.
        amount - Amount is required for MARKET and BUY side.
        type - MARKET, LIMIT, LIMIT_MAKER (Default: MARKET)
        timeInForce - GTC, IOC, FOK (Default: GTC)
        allowBorrow - allow order to be placed by borrowing funds (Default: false)
        Returns:
        order details

      • placeSmartOrder

        public SmartOrder placeSmartOrder​(String symbol,
                                  String side,
                                  String timeInForce,
                                  String type,
                                  String accountType,
                                  String price,
                                  String quantity,
                                  String amount,
                                  String clientOrderId,
                                  String stopPrice)
        Create Smart Order: Create a smart order for an account
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol name
        side - BUY, SELL
        timeInForce - GTC, IOC, FOK (Default: GTC)
        type - MARKET, LIMIT, LIMIT_MAKER (Default: MARKET)
        accountType - SPOT is the default and only supported one.
        price - Price is required for non-market orders
        quantity - Quantity is required for MARKET type and SELL side.
        amount - Amount is required for MARKET and BUY side.
        clientOrderId - client order id with a maximum 64-character length
        stopPrice - Price at which order is triggered
        Returns:
        smart order details
        Example:
          SmartOrder smartOrder = poloniexApiClient.placeSmartOrder("ETH_USDT", "BUY", "0.1", "STOP_LIMIT", "SPOT", "FOK", "3900", "100", "T_D_UP_" + System.currentTimeMillis(), "4000");

      • getOrders

        public List<Order> getOrders​(String symbol,
                             String side,
                             Long from,
                             String direction,
                             Integer limit)
        Open Orders: Get a list of active orders for an account
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol to trade,like BTC_USDT. Default is for all symbols if null is passed.
        side - BUY, SELL
        from - it is 'orderId'. The query begin at ‘from', and it is 0 when you first query.
        direction - PRE, NEXT
        limit - The max number of orders could be returned.
        Returns:
        list of orders
        Example:
          List<Order> orders = poloniexApiClient.getOrders("ETH_USDT", "BUY", null, "NEXT", 10);

                                            String[] clientOrderIds)

        Returns:

      • cancelAllOrders

        public List<CanceledOrder> cancelAllOrders​(String[] symbols,
                                           String[] accountTypes)
        Cancel All Orders: Batch cancel all orders in an account.
        Parameters:
        symbols - If symbols are specified then all orders with those symbols will be canceled. If symbols are not specified or array is empty, it will cancel user's all orders for all symbols.
        accountTypes - SPOT is the default and only supported one.
        Returns:
        list of order details

        Example: 
          List<CanceledOrder> canceledOrders = poloniexApiClient.cancelAllOrders(new String[]{"TRX_USDT"}, new String[]{"SPOT"});

      • getOrderHistory

        public List<Order> getOrderHistory​(String accountType,
                                   String type,
                                   String side,
                                   String symbol,
                                   Long from,
                                   String direction,
                                   String states,
                                   Integer limit,
                                   Boolean hideCancel,
                                   Long startTime,
                                   Long endTime)
        Orders History: Get a list of historical orders in an account
        Parameters:
        accountType - SPOT is the default and only supported one.
        type - MARKET, LIMIT, LIMIT_MAKER (Default: all types)
        side - BUY, SELL (Default: both sides)
        symbol - Any supported symbol (Default: all symbols)
        from - An 'orderId'. The query begins at ‘from'.
        direction - PRE, NEXT The direction before or after ‘from'.
        states - FAILED, FILLED, CANCELED. PARTIALLY_CANCELED Multiple states can be specified and separated with comma. (Default: all states)
        limit - The max number of orders could be returned. (Default: 100)
        hideCancel - true or false. Whether canceled orders should not be retrieved. (Default: false)
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) orders updated before startTime will not be retrieved.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) orders updated after endTime will not be retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of orders
        Example:
          List<Order> orders = poloniexApiClient.getOrderHistory("SPOT", "LIMIT", "BUY", "ETH_USDT", 58067963198046208L, "PRE", "CANCELED", 100, false, null, null);

      • getSmartOrderHistory

        public List<SmartOrder> getSmartOrderHistory​(String accountType,
                                             String type,
                                             String side,
                                             String symbol,
                                             Long from,
                                             String direction,
                                             String states,
                                             Integer limit,
                                             Boolean hideCancel,
                                             Long startTime,
                                             Long endTime)
        Smart Orders History Get a list of historical smart orders in an account
        Parameters:
        accountType - SPOT is the default and only supported one.
        type - STOP, STOP_LIMIT (Default: all types)
        side - BUY, SELL (Default: both sides)
        symbol - Any supported symbol (Default: all symbols)
        from - An 'smart orderId'. The query begins at ‘from'.
        direction - PRE, NEXT The direction before or after ‘from'.
        states - FAILED, FILLED, CANCELED. PARTIALLY_CANCELED. Multiple states can be specified and separated with comma. (Default: all states)
        limit - The max number of smart orders could be returned. (Default: 100)
        hideCancel - true or false. Whether canceled smart orders should not be retrieved. (Default: false)
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) smart orders updated before startTime will not be retrieved.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) smart orders updated after endTime will not be retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of smart orders
        Example:
          List<SmartOrder> smartOrders = poloniexApiClient.getSmartOrderHistory("SPOT", "STOP_LIMIT", "BUY", "ETH_USDT", null, null, "CANCELED", 1, false, null, null);

      • setKillSwitch

        public KillSwitchResponse setKillSwitch​(String timeout)
        Set Kill Switch Set a timer that cancels all regular and smartorders after the timeout has expired. Timeout can be reset by calling this command again with a new timeout value. A timeout value of -1 disables the timer. Timeout is defined in seconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Timer value in seconds; range is -1 and 10 to 600.
        Returns:
        kill switch response object
        Example:
          KillSwitchResponse killSwitchResponse = poloniexApiClient.setKillSwitch("15");

      • getKillSwitch

        public KillSwitchResponse getKillSwitch()
        Get Kill Switch Get status of kill switch. If there is an active kill switch then the start and cancellation time is returned. If no active kill switch then an error message with code is returned.
        Returns:
        kill switch response object
        Example:
          KillSwitchResponse killSwitchResponse = poloniexApiClient.getKillSwitch();

      • getTrades

        public List<Trade> getTrades​(Integer limit,
                             Long endTime,
                             Long startTime,
                             Long from,
                             String direction)
        Trade History: Get a list of all trades for an account.
        Parameters:
        limit - default and max value is 100.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) trades filled after endTime will not be retrieved.
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) trades filled before startTime will not be retrieved.
        from - A 'trade Id'. The query begins at ‘from'.
        direction - PRE, NEXT The direction before or after ‘from'.
        Returns:
        list of trades
        Example:
          List<Trade>> trades = poloniexApiClient.getTrades(10, 1655016096000L, 1655929390000L, 1000L, "NEXT");

      • getTrades

        public List<Trade> getTrades​(Integer limit,
                             Long endTime,
                             Long startTime,
                             Long from,
                             String direction,
                             List<String> symbols)
        Trade History: Get a list of all trades for an account.
        Parameters:
        limit - default and max value is 100.
        endTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) trades filled after endTime will not be retrieved.
        startTime - (milliseconds since UNIX epoch) trades filled before startTime will not be retrieved.
        from - A 'trade Id'. The query begins at ‘from'.
        direction - PRE, NEXT The direction before or after ‘from'.
        symbols - one or multiple symbols separated by comma
        Returns:
        list of trades
        Example:
          List<Trade>> trades = poloniexApiClient.getTrades(10, 1655016096000L, 1655929390000L, 1000L, "NEXT", List.of("BTC_USDT","ETH_USDT"));

        Trades by Order Id: Get a list of all trades for an order specified by its orderId.
        Parameters:
        orderId - the associated order's id (order's clientOrderId is not supported)
        Returns:
        list of trades
        Example:
          List<Trade>> trades = poloniexApiClient.getUserTradesByOrderId(62759197997072384L);
